DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study collect safety efficacy data IN.PACT Admiral™ Drug Eluting Balloon ( DEB ) treatment atherosclerotic disease superficial femoral and/or popliteal arteries `` real world '' patient population .
DOC.detailed_description: Peripheral artery disease ( PAD ) commonly result progressive narrowing artery low extremity , usually due atherosclerosis . Progression PAD result critical limb ischemia ( CLI ) , manifest ischemic pain rest breakdown skin , result ulcer gangrene ultimately may lead amputation death . The IN.PACT Global Clinical Study aim expand understand safety efficacy data IN.PACT Admiral™ DEB real world population subject intermittent claudication and/or rest pain ( Rutherford class 2-3-4 ) due obstructive disease superficial femoral and/or popliteal artery .
DOC.criteria: General inclusion Criteria : Age ≥ 18 year minimum age require local regulation . Subject documented diagnosis peripheral arterial disease ( PAD ) superficial femoral artery ( SFA ) and/or popliteal artery ( PA ) ( include P1 , P2 , P3 ) classify Rutherford class 234 . Angiographically documented single multiple lesions/occlusions ( de novo restenotic lesion ( ) instent restenosis ) within target vessel minimum lesion length 2 cm include bilateral disease limb treat within 35 day . General exclusion Criteria : High probability nonadherence Clinical Investigation Protocol followup requirement . Failure successfully cross target lesion guide wire ( successful crossing mean tip guide wire distal target lesion absence flow limit dissection perforation ) . Lesion within adjacent aneurysm presence popliteal aneurysm .
